steps: Place a small non-stick pan on the stove and turn the heat to LOW. This is important so the cheese does not burn.
Add the grated cheddar cheese into the pan.
Stir slowly and continuously with a spoon until the cheese fully melts and becomes smooth and creamy.
While the cheese is melting, put the tortilla chips into a small bowl, cup, or heat-safe glass.
Once the cheese is fully melted, carefully pour it over the tortilla chips.
Add salsa sauce on top of the cheese.
Sprinkle jalapeños if you like a spicy taste.
Let it cool for about 1 minute so it’s not too hot, then enjoy with a spoon or fork.
Place the chicken breast on a cutting board and cut it into very small bite-sized cubes.
Crack the egg into a bowl and beat it with a fork until smooth.
Put flour on one plate and breadcrumbs on another plate.
Take one chicken piece and coat it in flour.
Dip it into the egg, making sure it is fully covered.
Roll it in breadcrumbs until all sides are coated.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Carefully place chicken pieces into the hot oil.
Cook for about 3–4 minutes, turning them so all sides become golden brown.
Remove the chicken and place on paper towel to absorb excess oil.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve warm.
Peel the banana and cut it into thick round slices.
Place the chocolate into a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat it for 30 seconds, stir, then heat again until fully melted.
Dip each banana slice into the melted chocolate using a fork.
Place them on a plate lined with baking paper.
Sprinkle crushed nuts on top if desired.
Put the plate in the fridge for 5 minutes until the chocolate hardens.
Serve cold as sweet bite-sized snacks.
Place the toast bread on a cutting board and cut it into small square pieces.
Spread a little pizza sauce on each piece using a spoon.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
Add sausage or pepperoni slices over the cheese.
Place the pieces in a pan, oven tray, or air fryer basket.
Cook on medium heat until cheese fully melts and edges are crispy (about 5–7 minutes).
Let cool slightly before eating as finger food.
Place the toast bread on a cutting board.
Use a glass to flatten the bread gently.
Put sausage and cheese near one edge.
Roll the bread tightly around the filling.
Heat butter in a pan on medium heat.
Place the roll into the pan and cook until all sides are golden.
Remove, slice into bite-sized pieces, and serve warm.
Cut deep lines across the bread without cutting fully through.
Melt butter in a small pan.
Crush garlic and mix into the butter.
Brush the garlic butter inside all cuts.
Insert cheese into the gaps.
Heat in a pan or air fryer until cheese melts.
Serve warm by pulling pieces apart.
Peel and boil the potato until very soft.
Mash it completely until smooth.
Shape into small balls using your hands.
Dip each ball into beaten egg.
Roll in breadcrumbs until coated.
Heat oil in a pan and fry until golden.
Remove and place on paper towel.
Serve hot with ketchup or yogurt sauce.
Pop the popcorn according to package instructions.
In another pan, melt butter and sugar together.
Stir continuously until golden and liquid.
Pour caramel over popcorn slowly.
Mix well to coat evenly.
Let cool slightly before eating.
Heat a pan on medium heat and melt butter.
Place tortilla flat in the pan.
Add cheese on one half of tortilla.
Fold tortilla in half.
Cook both sides until crispy and cheese melts.
Cut into triangles and serve warm.
Wash the apple and cut into thin slices.
Arrange apple slices on a plate like nachos.
Melt dark chocolate in microwave.
Drizzle chocolate and peanut butter on top.
Sprinkle crushed nuts.
Serve immediately and eat by hand.
Wash the strawberries thoroughly under clean water.
Remove the green tops and cut the strawberries into small bite-sized pieces.
Place the dark chocolate into a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat in the microwave for 30 seconds, remove and stir. Repeat until fully melted and smooth.
Put the strawberry pieces into a small serving bowl or glass.
Slowly pour the melted chocolate over the strawberries.
Sprinkle crushed nuts evenly on top.
Let it cool for 1–2 minutes so it thickens slightly, then serve with a small spoon.
Wash the cherry tomatoes and basil leaves gently and dry them with paper towel.
Prepare small skewers or toothpicks.
Place one tomato onto the skewer.
Add one mozzarella ball after the tomato.
Fold a basil leaf and slide it onto the skewer.
Repeat until all ingredients are used.
Arrange skewers on a small plate.
Drizzle olive oil lightly over the top and serve fresh.
Peel and clean the shrimp if not already prepared.
Place a pan on medium heat and melt the butter.
Finely chop the garlic and add it to the butter.
Cook garlic for about 30 seconds until fragrant (do not burn).
Add shrimp to the pan and cook, stirring, until they turn pink.
Pour cream into the pan and gently stir.
Let it simmer for about 2 minutes until slightly thick.
Remove from heat and serve warm with toothpicks or bread.
Add pancake mix, milk, and egg into a bowl.
Whisk until smooth and lump-free.
Heat a non-stick pan on low to medium heat.
Pour small heart shapes using a spoon or squeeze bottle.
Cook until bubbles appear on top, then flip carefully.
Cook the other side until golden.
Transfer to a plate and drizzle honey on top.
Serve warm.
Wash the grapes and dry them well.
Cut cheese into small cube shapes.
Take a toothpick and insert one grape.
Add one cheese cube after the grape.
Repeat until finished.
Arrange neatly on a small plate and serve chilled.
Slice the banana into round pieces and set aside.
Pour cream into a small pan and heat on low.
Add dark chocolate pieces to the warm cream.
Stir constantly until fully melted and smooth.
Remove from heat and pour into a small bowl.
Dip banana slices into the chocolate and serve immediately.
Lightly toast the bread.
Rub garlic gently over the warm surface.
Chop the tomato into very small cubes.
Spoon tomatoes onto the bread.
Drizzle olive oil over the top.
Cut into small pieces and serve.
Cut chicken into small pieces.
Cook in a pan on medium heat until fully done.
Shred chicken using a fork.
Mix with yogurt until creamy.
Spread mixture onto tortilla.
Roll tightly and cut into small pieces.
Serve warm.
Wash and slice strawberries.
Add yogurt into a serving glass.
Place strawberries on top.
Drizzle honey evenly.
Serve chilled.
Use a knife or cookie cutter to cut bread into heart shapes.
Toast lightly in a pan or toaster.
Spread Nutella evenly on top.
Slice banana and place on Nutella.
Serve warm or cold.
Heat a non-stick pan on medium heat and add olive oil.
Crack both eggs into a bowl and whisk with a fork.
Pour eggs into the pan and gently stir until fully cooked.
Toast the bread slice lightly.
Place cooked eggs on top of toast.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm as a high-protein gym meal.
Cut chicken breast into small cubes.
Heat pan and add olive oil.
Cook chicken on medium heat until fully white inside.
Add spices and stir.
Place cooked rice into a bowl.
Add chicken on top.
Serve warm as post-workout meal.
Drain tuna completely.
Mix tuna with Greek yogurt in a bowl.
Place lettuce on tortilla.
Add tuna mixture.
Roll tightly into wrap.
Cut in half and serve.
Add Greek yogurt into bowl.
Add protein powder.
Mix well until smooth.
Slice banana and add on top.
Serve cold.
Heat pan and add olive oil.
Pour egg whites into pan.
Add spinach on top.
Cook until set.
Fold omelette and serve.
Add oats and milk into a pot.
Cook on low heat and stir.
When thick, remove from heat.
Mix in protein powder.
Serve warm.
Add cottage cheese into bowl.
Chop tomato and add.
Drizzle olive oil.
Mix lightly and serve.
Add all ingredients into blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glass and drink cold.
Toast the bread.
Mash avocado with fork.
Spread avocado on toast.
Add turkey slices on top.
Serve immediately.
Boil water in a pot and cook the macaroni according to package instructions.
Drain the pasta and set aside.
In the same pot, add butter and let it melt on low heat.
Pour in the milk and slowly heat it (do not boil).
Add grated cheddar cheese and stir continuously until fully melted and creamy.
Add the cooked pasta back into the pot.
Mix gently until all pasta is coated with cheese sauce.
Serve warm and enjoy a comforting, creamy meal.
Peel the potatoes and cut them into small cubes.
Boil in salted water until very soft.
Drain completely and place into a bowl.
Add butter and mash until smooth.
Slowly add warm milk while mashing.
Continue until creamy and fluffy.
Serve hot as a cozy comfort side dish.
Butter one side of each bread slice.
Place cheese between the unbuttered sides.
Heat a pan on medium heat.
Place sandwich butter-side down.
Cook until golden brown, then flip.
Cook until cheese is fully melted.
Serve warm and stretchy.
Cut chicken into small pieces.
Add water or broth to a pot and bring to boil.
Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes.
Add noodles and chopped carrot.
Cook until noodles are soft.
Season lightly with salt.
Serve hot in a bowl and enjoy the warmth.
Boil rice in water until soft.
Drain and add milk.
Cook on low heat, stirring.
Add sugar and continue stirring.
Cook until thick and creamy.
Serve warm or chilled.
Crack eggs into a bowl and add milk.
Whisk gently.
Melt butter in pan on low heat.
Pour eggs and stir slowly.
Cook gently until soft and creamy.
Serve warm on a plate or toast.
Add oats and milk to a small oven-safe dish.
Stir and bake or cook in pan on low heat.
When soft and thick, remove from heat.
Drizzle honey on top.
Serve warm.
Heat milk in a small pot on low heat.
Add chocolate pieces.
Stir until fully melted.
Add sugar if desired.
Pour into mug and serve warm.
Cook chicken in a pan until soft.
Shred chicken into small pieces.
Add cream and stir.
Add warm rice.
Mix gently and heat 2 minutes.
Serve hot and comforting.
Toast the bread lightly.
Spread peanut butter evenly.
Slice banana and place on top.
Serve immediately.
Place yogurt into a microwave-safe bowl.
Warm gently for 15–20 seconds (do not boil).
Add honey and stir.
Sprinkle cinnamon and enjoy warm.
Place crackers on a plate.
Cut cheese into thin slices.
Place cheese on crackers.
Serve and snack slowly.
Crack egg into a bowl and whisk with milk.
Melt butter in pan on low heat.
Pour egg mixture and stir slowly.
Cook gently until soft and creamy.
Serve warm in a bowl.
Wash and slice apple thinly.
Mix yogurt and honey in a small bowl.
Dip apple slices into yogurt and enjoy.
Add oats and milk into a small pot or bowl.
Heat gently and stir until soft.
Drizzle honey on top.
Eat warm.
Mash avocado with a fork.
Spread avocado on crackers.
Serve immediately.
Heat milk gently in a small pot.
Add cocoa powder and stir.
Add honey if desired.
Pour into mug and drink warm.
Place cottage cheese into bowl.
Slice cucumber and add.
Drizzle olive oil.
Mix lightly and serve cold.
Toast the whole wheat bread lightly until golden.
Heat a small pan and add olive oil.
Crack the egg into the pan and cook to your preference.
Mash avocado in a small bowl with a fork.
Spread avocado on toast.
Place cooked egg on top.
Serve warm as an energizing breakfast.
Add Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Wash berries and place on top.
Drizzle honey over yogurt.
Sprinkle chia seeds.
Serve cold for a fresh, light breakfast.
Mash banana in a bowl.
Add egg and oats.
Mix well until batter forms.
Heat non-stick pan.
Pour small pancakes.
Cook both sides until golden.
Serve warm.
Add all ingredients into blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass.
Drink immediately for a refreshing start.
Chop tomato and spinach.
Heat pan and add olive oil.
Add vegetables and cook lightly.
Crack eggs into pan and stir.
Cook until softly set.
Serve warm.
Add chia seeds and milk into jar.
Stir well.
Let sit in fridge overnight or at least 2 hours.
Top with honey before eating.
Add oats and milk to pot.
Cook on low heat and stir.
Chop apple and add.
Cook until soft.
Top with peanut butter and serve warm.
Add cottage cheese into bowl.
Slice cucumber and add.
Drizzle olive oil.
Mix lightly and serve.
Whisk eggs in a bowl.
Add chopped vegetables and cheese.
Pour into small oven-safe cups.
Bake or pan-cook until set.
Serve warm.
Toast the bread slice lightly until golden and crispy.
Wash the tomato and cut it into very small cubes.
Place chopped tomato into a small bowl.
Finely chop basil leaves and add to tomato.
Drizzle olive oil and gently mix.
Rub the warm toast lightly with garlic.
Spoon tomato mixture on top of toast.
Cut into bite-size pieces and serve immediately.
Place hot cooked rice into a bowl.
Crack egg into a separate bowl and lightly beat.
Slowly pour egg over hot rice.
Stir quickly so heat gently cooks the egg.
Add soy sauce and mix well.
Serve warm as a comforting Japanese-style bowl.
Heat a pan on medium heat and lightly grease it.
Place tortilla flat into the pan.
Sprinkle cheese on one half of tortilla.
Fold tortilla over the cheese.
Cook until bottom is golden.
Flip carefully and cook until cheese melts.
Remove from pan, cut into triangles, and serve warm.
Heat a small pan on low-medium heat.
Add butter and let it melt.
Add curry powder and stir for 20 seconds.
Add chickpeas and stir to coat evenly.
Pour in cream and gently mix.
Simmer for 3–4 minutes until warm and creamy.
Serve hot with bread or rice.
Chop tomato and pepper into small pieces.
Heat olive oil in a pan.
Add peppers and cook until soft.
Add tomatoes and cook until juicy.
Crack eggs directly into pan.
Gently mix eggs into vegetables.
Cook until eggs are softly set.
Serve hot with bread.
Place hot rice into bowl.
Fry egg sunny-side up in small pan.
Place egg on top of rice.
Drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil.
Mix before eating.
Serve warm.
Add yogurt into bowl.
Grate garlic finely and mix in.
Drizzle olive oil on top.
Stir gently.
Serve as dip or side.
Boil noodles until soft, then drain.
Heat oil in pan on medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook briefly.
Add noodles and toss.
Pour soy sauce and stir well.
Cook 1 more minute and serve hot.
Whisk egg and milk in a bowl.
Dip bread into mixture.
Heat pan lightly and cook bread both sides.
Cook until golden.
Drizzle honey and serve warm.
Heat olive oil in pan.
Add spices and stir briefly.
Add chickpeas and toss well.
Cook until hot and fragrant.
Serve warm as a world-flavor bowl.

recipes.recipeName_en: Creamy Garlic Chicken with Herb Drizzle
steps: Pat the chicken breast dry using paper towel. Season both sides lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan on medium-high heat and add olive oil.
Place the chicken in the pan and sear for 3–4 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Remove chicken from the pan and set aside.
Lower the heat and add butter to the same pan.
Add finely minced garlic and gently sauté for 20–30 seconds (do not burn).
Pour in the cream slowly while stirring.
Let the sauce gently simmer until it thickens slightly.
Return chicken to the pan and spoon sauce over it.
Cook for another 4–5 minutes until chicken is fully cooked and sauce coats the meat.
Plate the chicken, pour sauce artistically over the top, and wipe plate edges clean before serving.

recipes.recipeName_en: Honey Glazed Salmon with Pan Reduction
steps: Pat salmon dry and lightly season with salt.
Heat a non-stick pan on medium-high and add butter.
Place salmon skin-side down and cook without moving for 3 minutes.
Flip gently and cook another 2 minutes.
In a small bowl mix honey and soy sauce.
Pour glaze into the pan and spoon over salmon continuously.
Allow glaze to bubble and slightly thicken.
Remove salmon carefully.
Spoon glossy glaze over fish before serving.
Boil pasta in salted water until al dente.
Reserve 3 tablespoons pasta water before draining.
In a pan, heat cream on low heat.
Add pasta water and stir.
Add drained pasta and toss gently.
Add parmesan gradually while mixing.
Drizzle truffle oil at the end.
Twirl pasta into the center of plate for visual effect.

recipes.recipeName_en: Pan Seared Steak with Herb Butter
steps: Remove steak from fridge 15 minutes before cooking.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat heavy pan until very hot.
Place steak and press gently.
Sear 2–3 minutes per side.
Lower heat, add butter and crushed garlic.
Spoon melted butter continuously over steak.
Rest steak for 3 minutes before slicing.
Slice and fan onto plate.
Cut a pocket into chicken breast carefully.
Mix spinach and cream cheese.
Stuff mixture into chicken.
Secure opening with toothpicks.
Sear chicken on all sides.
Lower heat, cover and cook until inside is done.
Slice diagonally and plate beautifully.
Melt chocolate and butter together slowly.
Whisk egg and sugar until pale.
Combine chocolate mixture gently.
Pour into greased cup.
Bake until edges set but center soft.
Turn out carefully and serve immediately.
Sauté shrimp quickly and remove.
Toast rice in butter.
Add warm water gradually, stirring.
Cook until creamy.
Return shrimp and parmesan.
Stir gently.
Spoon risotto into shallow bowl and tap plate for spread.

recipes.recipeName_en: Vanilla Cream with Fresh Berry Art Plate
steps: Whisk cream and vanilla until thick.
Spread cream artistically on plate.
Place berries carefully.
Finish with light dusting sugar.
Serve chilled.
Prepare 4 clean food containers and place them on the counter.
Wash all vegetables thoroughly and pat them dry.
Cut chicken breasts into equal-sized cubes so they cook evenly.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and any spices you like.
Heat a large pan, add olive oil, and cook chicken in batches until golden and fully cooked.
Remove chicken and let it cool slightly.
In the same pan, add broccoli and carrots with a splash of water.
Cover and steam-cook vegetables until slightly soft but still bright.
Divide chicken evenly between 4 containers.
Add vegetables next to chicken in each box.
Allow boxes to cool completely before closing lids.
Store in fridge for up to 4 days. Reheat one box at a time.
Rinse rice thoroughly and cook in a large pot. Set aside.
Chop onion finely.
Heat olive oil in a large pan.
Add onion and cook until soft and fragrant.
Add ground turkey and break it apart with spoon.
Cook until fully browned and no pink remains.
Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Allow turkey mixture to cool slightly.
Lay out 4 meal prep containers.
Divide rice equally among containers.
Top each portion with turkey mixture.
Let cool completely before sealing and refrigerating.
Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Wash sweet potatoes and cut into cubes.
Spread on baking tray and drizzle olive oil.
Roast sweet potatoes for 20 minutes.
Place salmon on second tray, drizzle oil and lemon.
Bake salmon for 12–15 minutes.
Remove and let both cool.
Portion sweet potatoes into containers.
Top with salmon pieces.
Cool completely and refrigerate.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Chop all vegetables very finely.
Whisk eggs in a large bowl.
Add vegetables and cheese.
Pour mixture into greased muffin tray.
Bake for 18–22 minutes until set.
Let muffins cool fully.
Store in airtight container in fridge.
Reheat 1–2 muffins per serving.
Prepare 4 jars or containers with lids.
Add oats evenly to each jar.
Pour milk equally into each jar.
Add yogurt and honey.
Stir very well so oats are fully soaked.
Seal jars and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, shake and enjoy.
Keeps fresh up to 4 days.
Rinse lentils until water runs clear.
Chop carrots and onion finely.
Heat oil in a large pot.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Add carrots and lentils.
Add 6 cups water and bring to boil.
Lower heat and simmer 25 minutes.
Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Cool completely before portioning.
Store in containers up to 5 days.
Boil pasta in a large pot until al dente.
Cut chicken into strips.
Heat oil and cook chicken fully.
Lower heat and add cream.
Drain pasta and mix into sauce.
Stir gently until coated.
Allow to cool.
Divide evenly into 4 containers.
Seal and refrigerate.
Wash all fruits very well under running water.
With adult help, peel banana and kiwi.
Cut all fruits into small bite-sized pieces.
Prepare a wooden skewer or straw.
Let the child slide fruits onto the skewer in colorful order.
Place on a plate in rainbow style.
Serve fresh and cold.
Peel banana and place into a bowl.
Mash banana very well using a fork.
Crack egg into bowl and mix.
Add oats and stir until batter forms.
Heat non-stick pan on low heat.
Drop tiny spoonfuls to make mini pancakes.
Cook slowly and flip carefully.
Let cool slightly before serving.
Use a star-shaped cutter to cut bread.
Place cheese on top of bread shapes.
Lightly butter the pan.
Toast bread slowly until cheese melts.
Remove carefully and place on plate.
Let cool slightly before giving to child.
Place bread on plate.
Spread cream cheese gently.
Use cucumber slices as eyes.
Cut tomato into small shapes for mouth.
Let the child decorate the face.
Cut sandwich into small pieces and serve.
Wash apple well.
With adult help, slice apple into rings.
Remove core carefully.
Spread peanut butter on rings.
Sprinkle colorful toppings.
Serve immediately.
Cut bread into small circles.
Spread pizza sauce.
Add cheese.
Decorate face using olives.
Bake or pan-toast until cheese melts.
Let cool and serve.
Wash all fruits.
Chop strawberries very small.
Place yogurt into clear cup.
Add fruits in colorful layers.
Drizzle honey on top.
Serve cold.
Peel banana and place on plate.
With adult help, cut a long line on top.
Insert chocolate chips and marshmallows.
Microwave 15 seconds.
Let cool and serve with spoon.
Place chicken on cutting board and cut into small bite-sized cubes.
Pat the chicken dry with paper towel to help it brown better.
Heat a pan over medium-high heat until hot.
Add olive oil and immediately add chicken pieces in a single layer.
Do not move chicken for the first minute to allow proper searing.
Stir and cook until all sides are golden and chicken is fully cooked.
Lower the heat slightly and add minced garlic.
Stir continuously for about 20 seconds until fragrant.
Add hot sauce and chili flakes.
Toss chicken in sauce until fully coated and sticky.
Turn off heat and let rest 30 seconds before serving.
Boil noodles in water until soft, then drain and set aside.
Heat a pan on medium heat and add sesame oil.
Add minced garlic and stir until fragrant but not browned.
Add gochujang and soy sauce, stirring to form a thick paste.
Add noodles into the pan.
Toss continuously so noodles absorb the spicy sauce.
Cook for 1–2 minutes until glossy and well coated.
Serve hot and spicy.
Peel and clean shrimp, pat completely dry.
Heat pan on high heat until very hot.
Add butter and immediately add shrimp.
Let shrimp sear without moving for 30 seconds.
Flip shrimp and add garlic.
Stir quickly until fragrant.
Add chili paste and toss shrimp rapidly.
Cook until shrimp turn bright pink and sauce coats them.
Serve immediately while sizzling.
Slice chicken into thin strips.
Pat dry and season with chili powder and salt.
Heat oil in pan on high heat.
Add chicken and cook quickly to sear.
Add minced garlic and toss.
Warm tortillas separately.
Fill tortillas with spicy chicken.
Serve hot with optional lime.
Wash potato thoroughly and cut into cubes.
Dry potato pieces with paper towel.
Heat oil in pan on medium-high.
Add potatoes and spread evenly.
Let cook without stirring for 2 minutes.
Flip and cook until crispy.
Sprinkle chili flakes and paprika.
Toss and cook another minute.
Serve hot and crunchy.
Chop chili and garlic very finely.
Heat oil in pan on high heat.
Add chili and garlic and stir quickly.
Immediately add cooked rice.
Press rice flat and let it toast slightly.
Add soy sauce and stir well.
Cook another minute and serve hot.
Peel boiled eggs carefully.
Slice eggs in half lengthwise.
Remove yolks and place in bowl.
Mash yolks until smooth.
Add hot sauce, mustard, and chili powder.
Mix until creamy and spicy.
Spoon mixture back into egg whites.
Sprinkle extra chili powder on top.
Serve chilled or slightly warm.
Place the chicken breast on a plate and pat it dry with a paper towel (this helps it brown nicely).
Season both sides lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick pan on medium heat. If your pan sticks easily, add 1–2 teaspoons of water instead of oil and let it heat up for 10 seconds.
Add the chicken to the pan. Cook for about 4–5 minutes on the first side without moving it too much.
Flip the chicken and cook another 4–5 minutes until fully cooked (inside should be white, no pink).
Move chicken to a plate and let it rest for 2 minutes (resting keeps it juicy). Then slice into thin strips.
While chicken rests, wash greens, cucumber, and tomatoes. Slice cucumber and cut tomatoes in half.
Add greens, cucumber, and tomatoes to a large bowl.
In a small cup, mix lemon juice, olive oil, a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir well.
Add sliced chicken on top of the salad and drizzle the lemon dressing. Toss gently and serve.
Wash spinach and mushrooms. Slice mushrooms thinly and dice the tomato.
Heat a non-stick pan on low-medium heat. If using oil spray, do one quick spray (or add 1–2 teaspoons water).
Add mushrooms first and cook 2 minutes until they soften and release moisture.
Add spinach and stir for 30 seconds until it wilts down.
Pour egg whites into the pan. Let them sit for 10–15 seconds so the bottom starts to set.
Using a spatula, gently push eggs from the edges toward the center, repeating slowly (this keeps the scramble soft).
Add diced tomato near the end so it stays fresh and not watery.
Cook until egg whites are fully set (no clear liquid), then serve immediately.
Wash the cucumber and cut it in half lengthwise.
Use a small spoon to gently scoop out the seeds to create a 'boat' shape (leave some flesh so it stays sturdy).
In a bowl, add drained tuna, yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Mix with a fork until the tuna becomes a creamy filling (taste and adjust seasoning).
Spoon the tuna mixture into the cucumber boats.
Slice each boat into 2–3 bite pieces if you want finger-food style.
Serve chilled for a crisp, light snack.
Wash zucchini and cut off the ends.
Use a peeler to make long thin strips (or spiralize if you have a tool).
Pat zucchini noodles lightly with paper towel to remove extra water (this prevents soggy noodles).
Heat a pan on medium heat and add olive oil.
Add minced garlic and stir for 15–20 seconds until fragrant (do not brown).
Add zucchini noodles and toss for 2–3 minutes only (they should stay slightly firm).
Turn off heat and add parmesan if using. Toss once more.
Serve immediately (zucchini releases water if it sits too long).
Dice onion and mince garlic.
Heat a pot on medium heat and add olive oil.
Add onion and cook 2–3 minutes until soft and slightly translucent.
Add garlic and stir for 15 seconds.
Chop tomatoes and add to the pot. Stir and cook 3 minutes to release juices.
Pour in water or broth. Bring to a gentle boil.
Lower heat and simmer for 8–10 minutes.
Use a blender (or mash carefully) to make it smoother.
Taste and add salt/pepper if needed.
Serve warm.
Wash cucumber and tomato.
Dice cucumber and tomato into small bite-size pieces.
Slice red onion very thinly (thin slices taste milder).
Add vegetables into a bowl.
Crumble feta cheese on top.
Mix olive oil and lemon juice in a small cup, then drizzle over salad.
Toss gently and serve immediately.
Drain chickpeas and rinse quickly under water, then drain again.
Pat chickpeas very dry with paper towel (dry = crispy).
Place chickpeas into a bowl and add olive oil, paprika, and salt.
Mix well so spices coat every chickpea.
If using air fryer: cook at 200°C (390°F) for 10–12 minutes, shaking halfway.
If using oven: spread on tray and bake at 200°C for 18–20 minutes.
Let cool 2 minutes after cooking (they crisp up more as they cool).
Eat as a crunchy, high-fiber snack.
Slice cucumber into small cubes or thin half-moons.
Add cottage cheese to a bowl.
Add cucumber on top.
Drizzle lemon juice and sprinkle black pepper.
Mix gently and eat cold.
If you want it extra filling, add more cucumber (almost no calories).
If using frozen berries, no need to thaw (it makes the smoothie thicker).
Add berries into blender first.
Add Greek yogurt on top.
Pour water (or add a few ice cubes).
Blend for 30–45 seconds until smooth.
Taste: if too thick, add a little more water and blend again.
Pour into a glass and drink immediately.
Break the chocolate into small pieces and place them into a microwave-safe mug.
Add butter to the same mug.
Microwave for 20–30 seconds until melted.
Stir very well until smooth and glossy.
Add the egg and mix quickly so it doesn’t cook from the heat.
Add sugar and flour, and stir until no lumps remain.
Microwave for 30–40 seconds (center should stay slightly soft).
Let it rest 30 seconds.
Eat warm directly from the mug for lava effect.
Wash strawberries and pat them completely dry.
Remove stems and slice strawberries into halves.
Place chocolate into a small bowl.
Melt in microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring each time.
Place strawberries into a serving bowl.
Pour melted chocolate over strawberries.
Sprinkle crushed biscuits on top.
Serve immediately while chocolate is warm.
Toast bread lightly until golden.
Spread Nutella evenly while toast is still warm.
Slice banana into thin rounds.
Arrange banana slices on top.
Optional: warm for 20 seconds in microwave.
Serve warm for stronger chocolate aroma.
Place flour in microwave and heat 40 seconds to make it safe to eat.
In a bowl, mix softened butter and sugar until creamy.
Add flour and mix until soft dough forms.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Roll small balls with your hands.
Chill 5 minutes and enjoy.
Wash and peel apple.
Cut into small cubes.
Place apple in microwave-safe bowl.
Add honey and cinnamon and mix.
Microwave 2 minutes until soft.
Sprinkle oats on top.
Microwave another 30 seconds.
Stir gently and eat warm.
Peel banana and cut into thick slices.
Insert toothpicks into banana pieces.
Melt chocolate gently.
Dip banana into chocolate.
Sprinkle nuts.
Place on parchment paper.
Freeze 5–10 minutes.
Serve cold like mini ice cream.
Pour cold cream into a bowl.
Whisk vigorously until fluffy.
Add sugar and whisk again.
Slice strawberries.
Layer cream and strawberries in a glass.
Serve immediately or chill 5 minutes.
Add all ingredients into a microwave-safe mug.
Mix thoroughly until smooth.
Microwave for 45–60 seconds.
Check center; it should be slightly soft.
Let cool 30 seconds.
Eat warm.
Warm tortilla lightly in a pan.
Place banana in the center.
Drizzle caramel sauce.
Roll tightly.
Toast in pan until golden.
Slice and serve warm.
Put the bread in a toaster (or a dry pan) and toast until lightly golden.
While the bread toasts, crack the egg into a small bowl (this helps avoid shell pieces).
Heat a non-stick pan on medium heat. If needed, add a tiny splash of water to prevent sticking.
Pour the egg into the pan and cook 1–2 minutes for a soft yolk (longer if you want it firm).
Cut the avocado, scoop out about 1/4, and mash it in a bowl with a fork.
Season the mashed avocado with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Spread the avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
Place the cooked egg on top of the avocado toast.
Add another pinch of pepper (optional) and serve immediately while warm.
Open the tuna can and drain the water completely (press the lid down carefully).
Add drained tuna into a bowl and break it apart with a fork.
Add Greek yogurt on top of the tuna.
Add lemon juice and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Mix well until creamy and evenly combined.
Taste and adjust: more lemon for freshness, more salt for flavor.
Eat with a spoon, or scoop with cucumber slices/bread if you have them.
Place a pan on medium heat and let it warm up for 30 seconds.
Add butter/oil and spread it around the pan.
Lay the tortilla flat in the pan.
Sprinkle cheese over half of the tortilla (keep it on one side so it folds easily).
Fold the tortilla in half like a book, pressing gently with a spatula.
Cook 2 minutes until the bottom is golden and cheese starts melting.
Flip carefully and cook another 1–2 minutes until crispy.
Move to a cutting board, let it rest 30 seconds (cheese sets slightly).
Cut into triangles and eat warm.
Wash the tomato and cut it into small cubes.
Crack eggs into a bowl and whisk with a fork until the yolks and whites blend.
Heat a pan on medium heat and add olive oil.
Add diced tomato and cook 1 minute to release juices.
Pour the whisked eggs into the pan.
Wait 10 seconds, then gently stir from the edges toward the center.
Cook until eggs are set but still soft (about 2–3 minutes).
Season with salt and serve hot.
Add Greek yogurt to a bowl or cup.
Slice half a banana into thin rounds.
Place banana slices on top of the yogurt.
Drizzle honey over the top.
Mix lightly if you want, or eat in layers.
Wash the cucumber and slice it into small cubes or thin half-moons.
Add cottage cheese to a bowl.
Add cucumber on top.
Add lemon juice and black pepper.
Mix gently and eat cold.
Lay the tortilla flat on a plate.
Spread peanut butter evenly across the tortilla.
Peel banana and place it in the center.
Roll the tortilla tightly around the banana.
Slice into bite-size pieces (optional).
Eat immediately, or toast in a pan for 1 minute per side for extra crunch.
Boil water in a pot or kettle.
Cook noodles in boiling water for 2–3 minutes until soft.
Drain noodles, leaving 2 tablespoons of water in the pot (helps sauce coat).
Add minced garlic to the warm pot (use low heat).
Add soy sauce (and sesame oil if using).
Add noodles back in and toss quickly until coated.
Turn off heat and serve hot.
Slice the tomato into thin rounds.
Place bread in a pan on low-medium heat.
Add mozzarella on top of bread.
Place tomato slices on top of the cheese.
Cover the pan with a lid (this melts cheese faster).
Cook 3–4 minutes until cheese melts fully.
Remove and let it cool 30 seconds before eating.
Add oats to a microwave-safe bowl (use a big bowl to prevent overflow).
Pour milk (or water) over oats and stir once.
Microwave for 60 seconds.
Stir well, then microwave another 30–45 seconds until thick.
Let sit 1 minute (it thickens more).
Drizzle honey on top and eat warm.
If your rice is cold, microwave it for 30–40 seconds so it becomes sticky and easy to shape.
Place a piece of plastic wrap on the counter (this prevents rice from sticking to your hands).
Spread the warm rice into a thin rectangle on the plastic wrap and press firmly so it holds together.
Fold the rice rectangle gently into a taco shape (like a U) and keep the fold tight so it doesn’t break.
Place the folded rice into a hot dry pan for 1 minute per side to lightly crisp the outside (optional but fun).
In a bowl, mix drained tuna with soy sauce and mayonnaise until creamy.
Cut the nori sheet into a strip and wrap it around the rice taco as a ‘belt’ to hold shape.
Stuff cucumber slices inside first (adds crunch), then spoon the tuna mixture on top.
Serve immediately while the outside is warm and the inside is cool and fresh.
Pop the popcorn using an air popper or a pot with a lid (avoid heavy butter to keep it light).
Pour popcorn into a large bowl so you have room to mix without spilling.
Break chocolate into small pieces and microwave for 15–20 seconds, stir, then repeat until melted.
Drizzle honey into the melted chocolate and stir quickly (this makes a glossy sweet coating).
Drizzle the warm chocolate over the popcorn in thin lines (don’t dump it in one spot).
Sprinkle peanuts for crunch.
Add a tiny pinch of chili flakes for a surprise spicy kick (start small!).
Toss gently with two spoons so popcorn doesn’t break.
Let it sit 1–2 minutes so chocolate sets slightly, then snack immediately.
Add Greek yogurt to a bowl.
Add cream cheese on top (this makes it taste like cheesecake).
Mix very well with a spoon until the texture becomes smooth and thick (no white lumps).
Drizzle honey and stir once more so sweetness spreads evenly.
Crush biscuits in your hand or with a spoon until you get small crumbs.
Sprinkle biscuit crumbs over the yogurt mixture (this mimics cheesecake crust).
Slice strawberries and place them on top like a mini dessert decoration.
Chill for 2 minutes if you want it firmer, or eat immediately.
Boil water and cook the noodles for 2–3 minutes until soft.
Drain the noodles but keep 3 tablespoons of the hot noodle water in the pot (this makes the sauce creamy).
Turn the heat OFF completely (important: egg will scramble if heat is on).
Crack the egg into a bowl and whisk with a fork for 10 seconds.
Add the egg to the warm noodles and stir very fast for 20–30 seconds.
Add grated parmesan and keep stirring until it melts and becomes glossy.
Add black pepper generously (carbonara-style).
If too thick, add a small splash of the reserved hot water and mix again.
Serve immediately while creamy.
Cut watermelon into bite-size cubes (dry them slightly with paper towel so toppings stick).
Crumble feta cheese into small pieces using your fingers.
Place watermelon cubes on a plate with a little space between them.
Sprinkle feta evenly over the watermelon.
Drizzle lime juice lightly across the top (a little goes a long way).
If using mint, tear leaves with your hands (tearing releases aroma better than chopping).
Scatter mint on top for a fresh ‘chef’ finish.
Serve immediately while cold and juicy.
Slice halloumi into 2–3 thick pieces (thick slices stay juicy).
Heat a non-stick pan on medium-high heat (no oil needed; halloumi doesn’t melt).
Place halloumi slices in the pan and cook 1–2 minutes until golden underneath.
Flip and cook the other side until golden.
Mix honey and chili flakes in a small cup (this becomes hot honey).
Place cucumber slices on a plate as ‘mini buns’ (two slices per slider).
Put halloumi on top of cucumber slices.
Drizzle hot honey over the halloumi right before eating.
Serve immediately for the sweet-salty-spicy surprise.
Slice banana into thin rounds so it warms quickly inside the tortilla.
Place tortilla flat on a cutting board.
Scatter chocolate pieces on one half of the tortilla.
Add banana slices on top of the chocolate.
Fold the tortilla in half like a book and press gently.
Heat a pan on medium heat; add a tiny bit of butter if you want extra crisp.
Cook 1–2 minutes per side until golden and the chocolate melts inside.
Transfer to a board and rest 30 seconds (hot filling can burn your mouth).
Cut into triangles and serve warm.
Add oats and water to a small pot or microwave-safe bowl.
Cook for 2–3 minutes until thick like porridge (stir once halfway).
While oats cook, boil or fry one egg (quickest: fry in a non-stick pan).
Pour cooked oats into a bowl and smooth the surface with a spoon.
Add soy sauce around the edges (this spreads flavor without making it too salty in one spot).
Place the egg on top like a ramen bowl.
Sprinkle chili flakes for heat.
Mix gently as you eat so every bite gets egg + oats.
Add instant coffee to a small cup.
Pour hot water over coffee and stir until fully dissolved.
Place ice cream scoops into a serving glass or bowl.
Slowly pour the hot coffee over the ice cream (it should melt around the edges).
If using chocolate, grate or break it into tiny pieces and sprinkle on top.
Serve immediately with a spoon (half drink, half dessert).
Place potato chips into a bowl (use a wide bowl so mixing is easy).
Pat pickle slices dry with paper towel (this prevents soggy chips).
Chop pickles into tiny pieces so you get a little tang in each bite.
Add chopped pickles on top of chips.
Add peanuts for extra crunch and salty balance.
If you like it spicy, drizzle a small amount of hot sauce (don’t overdo; chips get soft).
Toss quickly with a spoon, eat immediately for the best crunch.
